newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL shares close weaker as sentiment stays fragile.
newsitem.headline: KL shares close weaker as sentiment stays fragile.

text.p: Shares traded mostly in the red to the end as sentiment remained fragile and buyers stayed away on Thursday, dealers and analysts said.
They said the market's southward direction was likely to continue in the immediate term as it has not found a firm bottom.
"It's not time to buy. The market hasn't stabilised yet," said Victor Wan, senior analyst at South Johor Securities.
The Composite Index of 100 large-capitalised stocks fell 15.89 points or 1.37 percent to 1,147.96, off its intraday low of 1,143.33.
The Emas Index fell 5.16 or 1.53 percent to 332.10.
The central bank's curbs on property and share-buying which have caused steep market falls continued to take its toll on players' confidence of the market's stability, dealers said.
"Sentiment is very bad. People are licking their wounds. With this kind of sentiment, the market might test support at 1,100," said a dealer at a bank-owned house.

A number of dealers said their foreign clients were mostly sidelined today as they expect to be able to buy stocks at lower levels. "It's been very quiet here. We've had few orders," said an equity salesman at a U.S.-linked house.
